description: From Middle English egged, from Old English ecged; equivalent to edge +â€Ž -ed.

adjectives.description: edged (comparative more edged, superlative most edged)

entries.meaning: That has a sharp planar surface.
examples: The monks were forbidden to carry edged weapons such as swords and axes.

entries.meaning: (followed by with or in a compound adjective) Having an edging of a certain material, color, and so on.
simple past tense and past participle of edge
examples: Already a mentally fragile boy, he now edged towards insanity.
